unnormalised: ## Return to Sender? Decoding the Retail Return Ruckus!
normalised: ## Return to Sender? Decoding the Retail Return Ruckus!

unnormalised: So, you bought that shimmering Banarasi saree online after seeing it on Instagram. Looked fabulous on Deepika Padukone, didn't it? But now that it's arrived, it looks less "Bollywood glam" and more "dadi's moth-eaten drape." What do you do? Return it, obviously! But before you dive headfirst into the chaotic world of return policies, let’s get a few things straight.
normalised: So, you bought that shimmering Banarasi saree online after seeing it on Instagram. Looked fabulous on Deepika Padukone, didn't it? But now that it's arrived, it looks less "Bollywood glam" and more "dadi's moth-eaten drape." What do you do? Return it, obviously! But before you dive headfirst into the chaotic world of return policies, let's get a few things straight.

unnormalised: Return policies, my friends, are like that crazy auntie at a wedding – unpredictable and potentially embarrassing. Some are sweet as jalebis, offering a no-questions-asked refund. Others are stricter than your IIT JEE physics professor, Dr. Sharma, requiring you to perform a full product autopsy before even considering a return.
normalised: Return policies, my friends, are like that crazy auntie at a wedding – unpredictable and potentially embarrassing. Some are sweet as jalebis, offering a no-questions-asked refund. Others are stricter than your I I T J E E physics professor, Doctor Sharma, requiring you to perform a full product autopsy before even considering a return.

unnormalised: The biggest battleground is often the "conditions apply" clause. Did you remove the tag? Did you accidentally spill chai on it while watching *The Kapil Sharma Show*? Did your pet parrot use it as a chew toy? If the answer to any of these is "yes," chances are your return is going straight to the dustbin.

unnormalised: Then there's the dreaded "restocking fee." This is basically the retailer's way of saying, "You wasted our time, so pay up!" Think of it as a penalty for your bad decision-making. (Rs. 200 restocking fee, minimum. Ouch!)
normalised: Then there's the dreaded "restocking fee." This is basically the retailer's way of saying, "You wasted our time, so pay up!" Think of it as a penalty for your bad decision-making. (rupees two hundred restocking fee, minimum. Ouch!)

unnormalised: And don't even get me started on the return window. Is it 7 days? 14? 30? Make sure you mark it on your calendar like it's the launch of Chandrayaan-3! Otherwise, you'll be stuck with that questionable purchase forever.

unnormalised: Pro Tip: Always read the fine print before hitting that "Buy Now" button. It might save you a trip to the consumer court and a lot of unnecessary stress. Think of it as preventative medicine for your shopping sanity. Also, measure your living room in sq ft BEFORE buying that oversized sofa. Returns on those are a nightmare. We are talking about coordinating delivery guys covering distances of 250km. Jai Shri Ram! Now, go forth and shop responsibly!
